columns.text: In this exercise, we need to prepare the 2018 Statement of Cash Flows for Smolira Golf Corp using the information provided.

Note that for this we will need to use information from both the Balance Sheet (from 2017 to 2018) and the Income Statement of 2018. This is because we need to add and subtract values to know the increase or decrease of certain assets and liabilities during two periods.

The **statement of cash flows** is a tool that summarizes a firm's sources and uses of cash over a specified period of time.

Next, we can prepare the cash flow statement:

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Smolira Golf Corp.}\\
\textbf{2018 Statement of Cash Flows }\\
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Cash, beginning of year}&&\underline{\$34,385}\\
\text{Operating activity }\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Net income}&&\$62,235\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Plus:}\\
\hspace{15pt}\text{Depreciation }&&\$44,463\\
\hspace{15pt}\text{Increase in accounts payable}&&\$5,860\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Less:}\\
\hspace{15pt}\text{Increase in accounts receivable}&&-\$9,965\\
\hspace{15pt}\text{Increase in inventory}&&\underline{-\$6,322}\\
\hspace{25pt}\text{Net cash from operating activity}&&\underline{\$96,271}\\
\text{Investment activity}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Fixed asset acquisitions}&&\underline{-\$99,781}\\
\hspace{25pt}\text{Net cash from investment activity}&&\underline{-\$99,781}\\
\text{Financing activity }\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Decrease in notes payable }&&-\$2,808\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Decrease in long-term debt }&&\$30,000\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Dividends paid }&&-\$25,000\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Increase in common stock}&&\underline{\$\hspace{31pt}0}\\
\hspace{25pt}\text{Net cash from financing activity}&&\underline{\$2,192}\\
\text{Net increase in cash }&&\underline{\$3,452}\\
\text{Cash, end of year  }&&\underline{\underline{\$37,837}}\\
\end{array}$$

The cash balance at the end of the year is $37,837
